title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping tale of racial injustice in the Deep South. Follows Scout Finch's journey through moral and social struggles.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime and its control over truth. Follows Winston Smith’s rebellion against Big Brother.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty romance exploring love and societal expectations. Elizabeth Bennet navigates complex feelings for Mr. Darcy.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tragic story of love, wealth, and the American Dream. Follows Jay Gatsby's pursuit of a lost love in the Roaring Twenties.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of Captain Ahab’s obsessive hunt for a giant whale. Explores themes of fate, obsession, and nature’s power.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A vast narrative of Russian aristocracy during the Napoleonic Wars. Examines the complexities of life, love, and war.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story of teenage rebellion and isolation. Follows Holden Caulfield as he struggles with the adult world around him.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A magical adventure where Bilbo Baggins helps dwarves reclaim their home. A precursor to Tolkien's 'Lord of the Rings' saga.

title: The Spy
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A historical fiction based on the life of Mata Hari, accused of espionage. Explores themes of fame, betrayal, and resilience.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological exploration of guilt, crime, and morality. Follows Raskolnikov’s internal struggle after committing murder.
